author: Staff Reporter
text:
Coimbatore Corporation has won a Central Government award for tapping solar power to use in its establishments. Corporation Commissioner K. Vijayakarthikeyan told journalists here on Monday that the civic body was the only one in Tamil Nadu and one among the few in the country to win the award – a prize of Rs. 10 lakh and a shield.

The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy Resources will give the award at a function to be held soon in New Delhi.

The Corporation has installed solar power plants at its main office in Town Hall, five zonal offices, a few schools and maternity centres.

The installed capacity of solar panels in the five zonal offices was 37.5 kw, six maternity centres was 45 kw, the main office was 50 kw, 15 schools was 112.5 kw and other establishments was another 12 kw, Mr. Vijayakarthikeyan said.

The Corporation installed the solar panels in the main office in 2014-15 and at other places in 2015-16.

In the course of the year, the civic body met most of its requirements.

The exact number of units the Corporation was able to save will be known soon, he further said.

Consequent to the award, the Corporation has asked the Central Government for Rs. 2 crore to install more solar panels, he added.
title: Award for Coimbatore Corporation
